meanings.definition: Coming after, in time or order; following.
meanings.sent1: The secund book in the series continues the exciting story.
meanings.sent2: The secund train arrived just as the first one departed.
meanings.sent3: The secund cupcake was so eager to be eaten that it jumped into my mouth.
meanings.sent4: Her secund attempt at painting was a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The secund moon rose gently in the evening sky.

meanings.sent1: The secund chance she got made all the difference.
meanings.sent2: His secund opinion turned out to be the right one.
meanings.sent3: The secund sunny day in a row made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: The secund stroke of luck saved the day.
meanings.sent5: The secund piece of cake was even more delicious than the first.

meanings.definition: Being of the same kind or species.
meanings.sent1: The secund flower in the garden bloomed beautifully.
meanings.sent2: The secund puppy looked just like its mother.
meanings.sent3: The secund cookie in the jar was a perfect match for the first one.
meanings.sent4: The secund tree in the row bore the sweetest fruits.
meanings.sent5: The secund bird chirped in harmony with the first.
